overview:
## Return Value

The shared [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesType] instance based on the provided identifier.

## Discussion

This method returns an instance of the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesType] concrete subclass. HealthKit uses series types to represent samples that store a series of items. You can’t directly instantiate these samples; instead, use a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesBuilder] subclass to create them. Use series types to ask  for permission to read series data from the HealthKit store.

# seriesType(forIdentifier:)

**Type Method**

Returns the shared series type for the provided identifier.

## Declaration

```swift
class func seriesType(forIdentifier identifier: String) -> HKSeriesType?
```

## Parameters

- **identifier**: A series type identifier. In iOS 11 and watchOS 4, there is only one series type identifier: [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKWorkoutRouteTypeIdentifier].

## Return Value

The shared [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesType] instance based on the provided identifier.

## Discussion

This method returns an instance of the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesType] concrete subclass. HealthKit uses series types to represent samples that store a series of items. You can’t directly instantiate these samples; instead, use a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKSeriesBuilder] subclass to create them. Use series types to ask  for permission to read series data from the HealthKit store.

## Related Documentation

- **workoutRoute()**: Returns a series type object for workout routes.
- **HKWorkoutRoute**: A sample that contains a workout’s route data.
- **HKWorkoutRouteBuilder**: A builder object that incrementally constructs a workout route.
